sentence.Network_en: I take wheat and yeast tablets daily to purify the blood.

sentence.Network_en: One tablet will purify a litre of water.
They open the windows to purify the air of the room.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们打开窗户清涤室内空气.

lj.lj_ly: genomic DNA was purified from whole blood.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French purifier, from Latin purificare, from purus 'pure'

entry.def: If you purify a substance, you make it pure by removing any harmful, dirty, or inferior substances from it.

example.ex: I take wheat and yeast tablets daily to purify the blood...
example.tran: 我每天服用干酵母片以净化血液。

means.word_mean: 1. remove impurities from, increase the concentration of, and separate through the process of distillation;
2. make pure or free from sin or guilt;
3. become clean or pure or free of guilt and sin;

sentences.sentence: "The hippies came to the ashram in order to purify"

auth_sentence.content: It makes no difference how you purify the water.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It makes no difference how you purify the water.

auth_sentence.content: The first of these was to gather and purify some drinking water.
auth_sentence.res_content: The first of these was to gather and purify some drinking water.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The first of these was to gather and purify some drinking water.

auth_sentence.content: He must purify the world of matter, erase its flaws, and approximate it to the idea.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不纯净的,不洁的;不道德的,下流的
stems_affixes.word_buile: im不+pur纯洁+e→adj.不纯净的,不洁的;不道德的,下流的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 纯的, 纯粹的, 纯净的, 无垢的
stems_affixes.word_buile: pur纯洁+e→adj.纯的, 纯粹的, 纯净的, 无垢的
pur纯洁+itan→n.清教徒 adj.清教徒的
impure[adj.不纯净的,不洁的;不道德的,下流的]+ity表名词→n.不纯;杂质;不道德
pur纯洁+itan→n.清教徒 adj.清教徒的
pur纯洁+ity表名词→n.纯净;纯洁;纯度

means.word_mean: 使纯净, 使洁净,净化

sentences.en: The air in the room was purified.
sentences.cn: 房间的空气得到了净化。

jushi.english: This salt has been purified for use in medicine.
jushi.chinese: 这种盐已被提纯供医药上使用。

jushi.english: You should purify the water before drinking it.
